Doc: Describes an option having a triggerable fixed payout.

Source.Contents:
/#
   Describes an option having a triggerable fixed payout.
 #/
record FpML5.recordkeeping.FxDigitalOption {
  # A classification of the most important risk class of the trade. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  primaryAssetClass : string

  # A classification of additional risk classes of the trade, if any. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.
  secondaryAssetClass : string?

  # A classification of the type of product. FpML defines a simple product categorization using a coding scheme.
  productType : string

  # A product reference identifier. The product ID is an identifier that describes the key economic characteristics of the trade type, with the exception of concepts such as size (notional, quantity, number of units) and price (fixed rate, strike, etc.) that are negotiated for each transaction. It can be used to hold identifiers such as the "UPI" (universal product identifier) required by certain regulatory reporting rules. It can also be used to hold identifiers of benchmark products or product temnplates used by certain trading systems or facilities. FpML does not define the domain values associated with this element. Note that the domain values for this element are not strictly an enumerated list.
  productId : string

  # Describes the type of any embedded optionality in the transaction that might not otherwise be apparent. Can be used to represent embedded optionality such as early termination provisions, extendible provisions, or cancelable provisions, etc., where applicable. If omitted, no embedded optionality is applicable.
  embeddedOptionType : string?

  # A reference to the party that buys this instrument, ie. pays for this instrument and receives the rights defined by it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (b). In the case of FRAs this the fixed rate payer.
  buyerPartyReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account that buys this instrument.
  buyerAccountReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.AccountReference?

  # A reference to the party that sells ("writes") this instrument, i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (a). In the case of FRAs this is the floating rate payer.
  sellerPartyReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.PartyReference

  # A reference to the account that sells this instrument.
  sellerAccountReference : FpML5.recordkeeping.AccountReference?

  # Effective date for a forward starting derivative. If this element is not present, the effective date is the trade date.
  effectiveDate : FpML5.recordkeeping.AdjustableOrRelativeDate?

  # A tenor expressed as a period type and multiplier (e.g. 1D, 1Y, etc.)
  tenorPeriod : FpML5.recordkeeping.Period?

  # The parameters for defining the exercise period for an American style option.
  americanExercise : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxDigitalAmericanExercise

  # Defines one or more conditions underwhich the option will payout if exercisable.
  touch : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxTouch

  # The parameters for defining the exercise period for an European style option.
  europeanExercise : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxEuropeanExercise

  # Defines one or more conditions underwhich the option will payout if exercisable.
  trigger : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxTrigger

  # A set of parameters defining procedures associated with the exercise.
  exerciseProcedure : FpML5.recordkeeping.ExerciseProcedure?

  # The amount of currency which becomes payable if and when a trigger event occurs.
  payout : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxOptionPayout

  # Premium amount or premium installment amount for an option.
  premium : FpML5.recordkeeping.FxOptionPremium

  id : string?

}

primaryAssetClass.Name: primaryAssetClass

secondaryAssetClass.Doc: A classification of additional risk classes of the trade, if any. FpML defines a simple asset class categorization using a coding scheme.

It can be used to hold identifiers such as the "UPI" (universal product identifier) required by certain regulatory reporting rules. It can also be used to hold identifiers of benchmark products or product temnplates used by certain trading systems or facilities. FpML does not define the domain values associated with this element. Note that the domain values for this element are not strictly an enumerated list.

Can be used to represent embedded optionality such as early termination provisions, extendible provisions, or cancelable provisions, etc., where applicable. If omitted, no embedded optionality is applicable.
embeddedOptionType.Name: embeddedOptionType

buyerPartyReference.Name: buyerPartyReference

buyerAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account that buys this instrument.
buyerAccountReference.Name: buyerAccountReference

sellerPartyReference.Doc: A reference to the party that sells ("writes") this instrument, i.e. that grants the rights defined by this instrument and in return receives a payment for it. See 2000 ISDA definitions Article 11.1 (a). In the case of FRAs this is the floating rate payer.
sellerPartyReference.Name: sellerPartyReference

sellerAccountReference.Doc: A reference to the account that sells this instrument.
sellerAccountReference.Name: sellerAccountReference

effectiveDate.Doc: Effective date for a forward starting derivative. If this element is not present, the effective date is the trade date.
effectiveDate.Name: effectiveDate

tenorPeriod.Doc: A tenor expressed as a period type and multiplier (e.g. 1D, 1Y, etc.)
tenorPeriod.Name: tenorPeriod

americanExercise.Name: americanExercise

trigger.Name: trigger

exerciseProcedure.Doc: A set of parameters defining procedures associated with the exercise.
exerciseProcedure.Name: exerciseProcedure

payout.Doc: The amount of currency which becomes payable if and when a trigger event occurs.
payout.Name: payout

premium.Doc: Premium amount or premium installment amount for an option.
premium.Name: premium
